title: Queen - Hammersmith Xmas Eve 1975
description:
This is the 'legendary' concert Queen performed on the Old Grey Whistle Test and BBC Radio on December 24, 1975. Legendary because it's been bootlegged so many times! 

However, unlike almost every other bootleg covering this night, I present to you the complete concert, which has never been fully broadcast on TV (the crew packed up their cameras before the second encore) or fully rebroadcast on radio (otherwise complete airings omit the Rock n Roll Medley). 

The majority of this concert comes from the 2009 Mix by Queen Productions. A 45 minute edit was broadcast on the BBC, and three other tracks omitted were released as either bonus tracks on the 2011 Queen Remasters or bonus videos on the 2011 iTunes versions. Missing audio (ie between songs) was flown in from other bootlegs or the original mono mix from the video. 

Unfortunately, only part of the Rock and Roll medley was broadcast in the 2009 edit, so roughly the last two minutes is in crappy mono. But every other song is in high quality stereo! 

Also, a snafu during Liar that was 'fixed' in 2009 has been unfixed. :) 

FLAC with ReplayGain metadata and cue file, however, main source was lossy audio. 

Introduction
Now I'm Here
Ogre Battle
White Queen
Bohemian Rhapsody
Killer Queen
March of the Black Queen
Bohemian Rhapsody (reprise)
Bring Back That Leroy Brown
Brighton Rock
Guitar Solo
Son and Daughter (reprise)
Keep Yourself Alive
Drum Solo
Keep Yourself Alive (reprise)
Liar
In The Lap of the Gods ... Revisited
Big Spender
Jailhouse Rock - Stupid Cupid - Be Bop A Lula (Medley)
Seven Seas of Rhye
See What A Fool I've Been
God Save The Queen (taped outro)
